creditline: The Mary and Robyn Campbell Fund for Art Books
description: small book with paper cover; worn, off-white simple cover with coral and blue floral pattern printed across the front, back and spine; printed text with some handwritten notes on inside, as well as hand written text on blank page at end of the book; four folding plates with various images- first plate: street scene with towering buildings; center building has arching canopy with a church spire in the back; many small figures mingling in the street; horse and carriage in LRC; figure in a hat and coat pushing a wheelbarrow in LLQ; printed text in top and bottom margins second plate: street scene with a large building with a round tower and figures adorning the center peak; groups of figures in the street below; text in top and bottom margins third plate: large building with decorative figures on central peak, with a figure in the middle holding a large sphere on shoulders; canal with connecting bridge in front of building fourth plate: plans of a grand building with several numbered rooms
markings: red stamp on back inner page, in center: WITHDRAWN/ CARNEGIE MELLON | stamp on back inner page in center: Hunt Libraries/ CMU
provenance: Hunt Library, Carnegie Mellon University, Pittsburgh, Penn., sold to Caliban, January, 2014; (Caliban Book Shop, Pittsburgh, sold to Gedge); (Samuel Gedge Ltd, Hanworth, Norwich, U.K.)
title: Description of the Cityhouse of Amsterdam
